Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2018 05:37PM daintyfloridagirl wrote: A rash that comes and goes is not inflammatory breast cancer. Symtoms progressively get worse within a matter of days. IBC is uncommon as well. You probably have a benign condition like eczema. I have gotten it on my chest a few times
Posts.Title: ibc rash? Please help Worried89 Worried89

Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2018 02:40AM daintyfloridagirl wrote: Inflammatory breast cancer symptoms simply do not come and go. Once you have symptoms, it can take a few days or even a few hours for symptoms to progressively get worse. Because the redness comes and go with you, I highly doubt it is inflammatory breast cancer. Of course, because no one on here can properly diagnose you, it would be wise to see a breast specialist. If you don’t have insurance/insurance won’t cover it, a lot of facilities may offer payment programs where you pay in increments.  Sorry you’re going through this and are worried. The main symptoms for IBC is swollen breast that’s keeps getting bigger, redness, hot and tender breast to the touch, orange peel appearance skin, etc. Mastitis often appears witha fever and chills. Perhaps you have a skin allergy. I wish I could offer more help and words of encouragement to but you shouldn’t worry much as it doesn’t sound like IBC. Good luck and I hope you get it figured out soon
Posts.Title: Non Lactational Mastitis - Anxiety Areonia Areonia
